fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article was wrong to say that Liverpool is the only UK city to have been named European capital of culture. Glasgow was also awarded that status in 1990, though Liverpool (in 2008) is the only English city to have been honoured (A culture boost for towns must just be the start, 5 January, page 5, Journal). • When we referred to cycle-hire docks being attacked with “axle grinders”, we meant angle grinders (Bike-share company Ofo withdraws from London, 11 January, page 42). • Other recently corrected articles include: Thais to vote in February for first time since invalidated 2014 poll ‘It has made me want to live’: public support for lesbian novelist Radclyffe Hall over banned book revealed
